definition: to nationalize/to take over as communal property

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: This is again a case of privatizing the gains and socializing the losses;
sentences.chinese: 这是又一次的私有化收益，公有化损失。

sentences.english: The new government communized all banks.
sentences.chinese: 新政府正在使所有银行公有化。

sentences.english: In China, the public has become a concern of the results.
sentences.chinese: 在我国，公有化已成为人们存眷的一个成绩。

sentences.english: As little as possible of the industry should be taken into public ownership.
sentences.chinese: 银行业尽可能少的被公有化。

definition: collectivization of agriculture (disastrous policy of communist Russia around 1930 and China in the 1950s)
"land to the tiller", post-Liberation land reform movement instigated by the CCP
ownership of the means of production (in Marxism)/system of ownership
